clinical_study.brief_title: Characterization and Causative Factors of Negative Dysphotopsia
clinical_study.official_title: Defining and Quantifying Negative Dysphotopsia Characterization and Causative Factors of Negative Dysphotopsia

lead_sponsor.agency: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

clinical_study.source: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The present study is designed as an exploratory study, seeking to investigate the correlation of patient complaints to subjective or objective measurement methods. Better understanding of causative factors of negative dysphotopsia will improve detection and maybe prediction of this optical phenomenon.

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of factors or a combination thereof that may cause negative dysphotopsia
primary_outcome.description: Biometry, Anamnesis, visual field, psychological questionnaires, wavefront aberrometry will be used to analyse if a factor causative for negative dysphotopsia can be detected

secondary_outcome.measure: Method to standardize characterization of negative dysphotopsia
secondary_outcome.description: New approaches like Goldmann visual field are used to try to picture negative dysphotopsias and patients will also be asked to draw the "dark shadows"

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between eye biometry, patient complaints and psychophysics
secondary_outcome.description: Eye biometry will be measured using IOL Master 700, patient complaints will be asked during an patient-doctor interview, and psychophysics will be assessed using a psychological questionnaire

study_pop.textblock: 10 patients after cataract extraction, suffering from negative dysphotopsia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pseudophakic
- Recurrently and persistently reporting about negative dysphotopsia
- Age 21 and older
- written informed consent prior to entering the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Relevant ophthalmic diseases such as: glaucoma, (previous) traumatic cataract, corneal scars, age-related macular degeneration and other pathologies resulting in visual field defects
- Pregnancy
